page.title: 13EAST LODGE FLORA, BROMSGROVE
page.content: On a hot and sunny summer's afternoon, ten children and their teacher walked across the hay fields of{East Lodge {Farm.}Some had been mowed and smelt sweet. Other fields were used as grass keep for cattle, whilst others had horses in them. {We identified the following flowers:- daisy,buttercup,cow parsley,dandelion, thistle, cleavers, mayweed, vetch, red and white clover, chickweed, catsear, willow herb, plantain, convolvulus, bittersweet, angelica,treacle mustard, dock, hawksbeard, birdsfoot trefoil, corn camomile, comfrey, sneezewort, scarlet pimpernel, poppy, fumitory, corn spurrey, teasel, stinging nettle, white dead nettle, hedge woundwort, speedwell, ragwort, yarrow, ribwort. {On the hedges we found:- } spindleberry, blackerry flowers, elder flowers, honeysuckle, dog roses.
